definitions: an advocate of a system in which two or more states, groups, principles, sources of authority, etc., coexist
shortDefinitions: advocate of system in which two or more states, groups, principles, sources of authority, etc., coexist

definitions: an advocate of devolution and autonomy for individual bodies in preference to monolithic state control

examples.text: although attractive to pluralists, this vision of local democracy had its limitations

shortDefinitions: advocate of devolution and autonomy for individual bodies in preference to monolithic state control

definitions: an advocate of a system of thought that recognizes more than one ultimate principle

examples.text: there is evidence that some of the early Greek philosophers were philosophical pluralists

shortDefinitions: advocate of system of thought that recognizes more than one ultimate principle

definitions: a member of the clergy who holds more than one ecclesiastical office at a time

examples.text: today many Anglican clergy in rural areas are technically pluralists

shortDefinitions: member of the clergy who holds more than one ecclesiastical office at time

definitions: relating to or advocating a system in which two or more states, groups, principles, sources of authority, etc., coexist
shortDefinitions: relating to or advocating system in which two or more states, groups, principles, sources of authority, etc., coexist

definitions: relating to or advocating devolution and autonomy for individual bodies in preference to monolithic state control

examples.text: we believe in a pluralist democracy

shortDefinitions: relating to or advocating devolution and autonomy for individual bodies in preference to monolithic state control

definitions: relating to a system of thought that recognizes more than one ultimate principle
shortDefinitions: relating to system of thought that recognizes more than one ultimate principle

definitions: (of a member of the clergy) holding more than one ecclesiastical office at a time

examples.text: pluralist clergy in the pre-Reformation parish system

shortDefinitions: (of member of clergy) holding more than one ecclesiastical office at time
